summary:
(RAG Format)
The patient presents with chronic emotional exhaustion, heightened stress, and unresolved tension related to multiple life stressors, including workplace conflicts, family responsibilities, and financial uncertainties. She expresses feelings of being overwhelmed and trapped in a cycle of constant problem-solving, with limited time for emotional recovery. Recurrent somatic symptoms, including headaches and vertigo, have emerged, potentially linked to accumulated stress and emotional overload.
main_issues: - Feelings of entrapment in problem-solving mode
limiting_beliefs: - "If I stop, everything will fall apart."
therapeutic_goals: - Establish boundaries to reduce emotional overload
- Implement stress-reduction techniques to alleviate somatic symptoms
- Facilitate emotional processing through grounding exercises
- Develop strategies for sustainable work-life balance

immediate: - Grounding techniques for acute stress relief
- Guided relaxation sessions to release muscle tension
- Hypnosis session recommendation: Stress release and mental decluttering
intermediate: - Processing of unresolved workplace conflicts through targeted EMDR
- Structured time management to reduce overwhelm
- Internal dialogue exercises to reframe limiting beliefs
long_term: - Creation of a safe mental space for emotional recovery
- Development of sustainable coping strategies for work-life balance
- Hypnosis session recommendation: Establishing a protective emotional boundary
